page.title: 03Climate,Rainfall
page.content: Rainfall figures are recorded locally. 1980-20";1981-23.1";1982-22.4";1983-20 .3";1984-20.6".Annual average 21.7". However within these annual figures there is often seasonal variation: 1980 1981 March,April,May 3.65" 8.6" June,July August 10.2" 4.8" In this arable farming area a wet growing period and dry ripening and harvest is preferable. Summer 1985 has been notable for being one of the wettest in living memory within England and Wales.Here in 10 months only 11.5" has fallen (about o.5 the annual average) In July 1985 only 1.7"of rain fell- only 2 months have been drier in the last 6 years.Many of the storms which swept the country missed this area.However the rain did cause some problems and battered down crops.
